net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.validation

Class EmailValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.validation.EmailValidator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Validator

    @Configurable(preConstruction=true)
public class EmailValidator
extends java.lang.Object
implements Validator
    Validates email in a Field.
    Author:
    Ken Logan (ken@i2rd.com), Kevin Beaty (kbeaty@i2rd.com)

    • Constructor Detail

      • EmailValidator

        public EmailValidator()
        Create a new instance with default email type and user entry not required.

      • EmailValidator

        public EmailValidator(@Nullable net.proteusframework.core.locale.TextSource emailType)
        Create a new instance with user entry not required.
        Parameters:
        emailType - Optional key (can be null) to help make a useful error message. Used as "Email Address entered for ${emailType} is not valid."

      • EmailValidator

        public EmailValidator(@Nullable net.proteusframework.core.locale.TextSource emailType,
                      boolean isUserEntryRequired)
        Create a new instance.
        Parameters:
        emailType - Optional key (can be null) to help make a useful error message. Used as "Email Address entered for ${emailType} is not valid."
        isUserEntryRequired - true if email is required. The default message is "Email is required.". You can change the message on the RequiredValueValidator. See getRequiredValueValidator().

    • Method Detail

      • custom

        public static EmailValidator custom(net.proteusframework.core.locale.TextSource invalidEmailMessage,
                                    boolean isUserEntryRequired)
        Create an EmailValidator with a custom validation message for an invalid email.
        Parameters:
        invalidEmailMessage - the message to display when an email address is entered and it is invalid.
        isUserEntryRequired - is entry required flag. If true, a RequiredValueValidator will be created. The default message is "Email is required.". The error message for the RequiredValueValidator can be changed by getting the validator. See getRequiredValueValidator()
        Returns:
        the email validator.

      • getRequiredValueValidator

        public java.util.Optional<RequiredValueValidator<?>> getRequiredValueValidator()
        Get the required value validator if enabled.

        Useful for changing the message.

        Returns:
        the required value validator.

      • isComponentValidationSupported

        public boolean isComponentValidationSupported(Component component)
        Description copied from interface: Validator
        Determine if this validator instance can be used with the given component.

        This is useful for reusable validators to implement and declare what components they support.

        Specified by:
        isComponentValidationSupported in interface Validator
        Parameters:
        component - The component.
        Returns:
        true if this validator supports the given component, otherwise false.

      • setEmailAddressValidator

        public void setEmailAddressValidator(@NonNull net.proteusframework.core.mail.EmailAddressValidator emailAddressValidator)
        Set the email address validator that does the functional validation of an address. By default an EmailAddressValidator is provided. Use this method to set a custom email address validator.
        Parameters:
        emailAddressValidator - the email address validator

        Description copied from interface: Validator
        Validate the specified component.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
